name: A Little to the Left: Drawers

editorialNotes.standard: Neatly arranging fountain pens and acrylic paints not only declutters drawers and cupboards but also soothes our minds.

After a long day at work, it’s bath time! But Swampy’s shower is broken and he needs your help to guide the water to him. Navigate a path through the dirt past contraptions and obstacles to get every drop to fill the bath.
Cool features like asynchronous multiplayer uplift the mobile version of this hit tabletop word association game.

name: A Little to the Left: Stars

ios.subtitle: The moving story of a lifetime

editorialNotes.standard: Moving’s a drag! Relocate to this satisfying puzzler in which you unpack boxes filled with all sorts of goodies.

Imagination becomes reality in 5th Cell’s spectacular puzzler—just write the name of almost anything in a magical notebook, and it appears before you. Expanding on the more linear Scribblenauts Remix, this game turns you loose to explore an open world. By creating everything from flying pigs to rocket launchers, you solve problems big and small for the people you meet. As the freedom to roam met the freedom to create, we got lost in coming up with the zaniest, most outlandish, or sometimes most diabolical ways to solve each scenario.

editorialNotes.tagline: Team up to solve the puzzles

editorialNotes.standard: Mesmerizing from start to finish, Monument Valley offers a world of uncanny beauty and constant wonder. To help a princess proceed on her mysterious quest, you’ll face ingenious puzzles that involve lifting and spinning the environment in seemingly impossible ways. It’s a mind-bending journey filled with the joy of discovery, making Ustwo’s adventure a must-play for gamers of every experience level.
Solve puzzles, inspect chilling notes and videos, and outrun a nightmarish smiling cat in the third chapter of this freaky horror series.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.short: Epic strategy battles on your wrist

editorialNotes.standard: In Baba Is You’s brilliant puzzles, rules are meant to be broken—or at least rewritten. Brick wall standing between you and the victory flag? Shift blocks of text to form phrases that change the way the world works. With a few moves, “wall is stop” becomes “wall is push”—and success is suddenly within your grasp. You’ll marvel as the game responds instantly to your newly created laws. Spell yourself into a corner? Just rewind and retrace your steps. Baba is you, and you’re in charge.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Imagine WALL·E directed by Tim Burton—that’s the weird, wonderful world of Machinarium. But this cute robot’s quest for love combines tons more influences—like point-and-click adventures, hidden-object puzzlers, and comic books—for a truly unique experience. Challenging but full of awesome “aha!” moments, it’s an artistic odyssey that looks amazing on iPhone, iPad, or Apple TV.

ios.subtitle: A story of beauty and illusion

editorialNotes.standard: We couldn’t wait to go back to the land of twisty towers and uncanny beauty—and this sequel didn’t let us down. With its striking colors and level design, it’s even more stunning than the first game. New elements like light beams and controlling two characters make the puzzles even trickier. The bond between that mother and child is what we’ll remember most, though—their relationship moved us in a way few games do.
editorialNotes.short: A powerful bond between mother and child drives this gorgeous, unforgettable game.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Limbo is a gripping blend of stark, haunting landscapes, bizarre characters, and unsettling sounds. With clever puzzle design, an intriguing narrative, and an excellent touch-screen control system, it’s as rewarding to play as it is interesting to look at and listen to.
editorialNotes.short: Dark, haunting, beautiful. This'll stay with you long after it's over.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: The enchantingly eccentric Rusty Lake series heads underground! Solve strange puzzles in train stations representing different eras of a woman’s life.

From the developer that brought the superb board game Carcassonne to iOS comes a fiendishly tricky puzzler that’ll test your memory and your reflexes. To clear each set of colorful tiles, you’ll need to follow specific rules in order—like removing odd-numbered tiles first, then ones with animals—before the clock runs out. Each super-short level is more tense and demanding than the last, making it that much more satisfying when you clean the board and progress to the next challenge.

editorialNotes.tagline: Jump in and save the ninjas!
editorialNotes.standard: Goofy banter, diverting puzzles, wall-to-wall action—we couldn’t ask for more from a LEGO Ninjago game. Using the warriors’ trademark weapons and elemental moves, you’ll battle the nefarious Ronin and his crew across Chen’s Island, the Toxic Bogs, and other familiar settings. Even if you’ve never seen the Masters of Spinjitzu animated series, these hilarious heroes and their kid-friendly shenanigans are guaranteed to win you over.

editorialNotes.tagline: This party game is the bomb!

editorialNotes.standard: When dinosaurs collide with LEGO bricks, you don’t have to be Mr. DNA to know the result is pure fun. Starring characters and creatures from all four Jurassic Park movies, this fantastic adventure lets you relive your favorite moments from the series and even create new ones with your own custom dinos. Full of all the humor, action, and surprises you expect, it’s a wacky team-up of T-Rex proportions.
Are aliens really out there? Discover the truth by rummaging through crop circles, pizza trucks, and more in this interactive hidden-object game.

Now here’s how you build a sequel! With The Room Three, Fireproof Games kept everything we love about this series—its chilling atmosphere, mind-bending puzzles, and beautiful visuals—while making masterful enhancements. It’s no wonder it’s an Honorable Mention for Best Mobile Game at this year’s Game Developers Conference. The story continues with trials set by a creepy new nemesis, The Craftsman. As you explore huge areas and tiny ones, the challenges feel increasingly epic, and a better-than-ever hint system ensures that finding solutions is super-rewarding.
editorialNotes.short: Brilliant puzzle designs and a haunting atmosphere make this unforgettable.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.tagline: Discover a memorable story full of humour
editorialNotes.standard: Double Fine’s riveting point-and-click adventure thrusts players into a timeless blend of whimsical sci-fi and dark fairy tale. Clever writing and stylish visuals keep its intersecting stories appealing—and at times, wickedly funny—with characters you’ll quickly become attached to (voiced by Elijah Wood, Jack Black, and other popular actors). Initially available with Act 1 only, Broken Age now includes the complete game—a one-of-a-kind odyssey that’s full of memorable moments.
editorialNotes.short: Discover a memorable story full of humor and charming characters.

name: Tick Tock: A Tale for Two
Smart Baby Shapes: Learning games for toddler kids

editorialNotes.standard: A terrific follow-up to our 2012 iPad Game of the Year, The Room Two continues the dark, foreboding tale introduced in its predecessor. Marvelously detailed graphics and eerie music make this first-person puzzler feel stunningly real, and as you travel from an ancient crypt to a séance room and beyond, you’ll love unlocking the secrets of every object—and learning more about your mysterious imprisonment.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: The solutions are as surreal as the landscapes in this curious hand-drawn adventure.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.tagline: It might be time to use your fireplace

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.short: Unravel family secrets on a remote island cursed by plagues in this dark puzzle adventure.

editorialNotes.standard: Talk about a sticky situation! Build structures with all sorts of goo to stretch this long-awaited physics puzzling sequel to new heights.
Search for a missing dog through lavishly illustrated cityscapes in this relaxing adventure game.

We love how Moncage’s puzzles show the importance of seeing things from different perspectives. The storytelling vignettes packed into the faces of a rotating cube connect and combine in ever-evolving, surprising ways, and the challenge of making those connections sparks creativity and renders the impossible suddenly possible. Rarely has the concept of thinking outside the box been illustrated so well.
With relaxed swapping rules and charming graphics, this surprisingly slick match-3 puzzler makes the genre feel fresh again.
Enigmatic settings and storytelling enrich the mysteries of Leonardo da Vinci's gadgetry in this escape room puzzle series’ fantastic conclusion.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Explore a gorgeous island packed with intricately interwoven puzzles. There’s a subtle logic to the world design that connects structures, land configurations, and puzzle grids. For persistent adventurers, The Witness is an unforgettable experience.
Tug, twist, and bend orbits to reach harmonic chimes in this meditative musical puzzler.

Being able to write computer code is a supremely useful talent, but learning the basics can be a tough, tedious slog. Human Resource Machine wraps computer logic fundamentals inside a wonderful, whimsical puzzle game, full of cartoon conveyer belts and demanding managers. It’s so much fun you might not realize how much knowledge you’re soaking up.

You might get stuck the first time you play Gorogoa. But once the gears of your brain settle into the right configurations, you’ll see how smart this mix of art and perspective really is. Layers pile upon layers, doors transport you between realities, strange creatures and wild environments blend together into a fascinating interactive collage you’ll want to peel apart to discover what lies underneath.

A rare kind of triumph, Prune takes a simple idea—pruning trees—and shapes it into a creative, deeply playable puzzle game. The visuals echo the style of Japanese painting in striking fashion, and the beautiful music instills a contemplative tone as you swipe to trim the limbs of a rapidly growing tree and guide it around obstacles. There’s no frantic pace, no demanding skills to master—only a quietly bewitching and unforgettable experience.
editorialNotes.short: A contemplative and creative experience - trimming trees has never been so beautiful.

editorialNotes.standard: Get to know your enemy—and try to predict their behavior—as you solve puzzles in this adventure game’s top-down dungeons.
Looking for good vibes? This heartwarming puzzler delivers again and again as you help a hen rescue her chicks.

Maze and hidden object genres blend together in Labyrinth City as you guide a French detective through increasingly bizarre crowded spaces. We love the delightful art style and barrage of visual surprises at every turn—we’re still laughing about that time a ridiculously large banana dropped out of a fruit truck. Don’t forget to take your time. The journey is more important than the destination, as this cheery adventure doubles as a celebration of the vibrancy and diversity of city life and the helpfulness of strangers.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: A fascinating reinvention of a longtime videogame franchise, Hitman GO takes familiar elements of stealth and assassination and reinterprets them as a wondrously stylized, turn-based boardgame. Each mission presents characters and scenes—some from previous Hitman games—as a sleek diorama, blending old and new to create an innovative experience. Even with helpful distractions and places to hide, inching toward your targets a step at a time demands keen strategy, and trying to pull off optional mission objectives quickly becomes an irresistible obsession.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Donut County is an absolute treat. You drag holes across land to collect bigger and bigger aboveground objects, from puddles and fire pits to trees and boulders. New ideas change gameplay in intriguing ways, and concepts never overstay their welcome, making every puzzle feel new and interesting. The consequences of every hole you control propel a wonderfully quirky story about a suddenly subterranean society seeking a return to the surface. Along with the game’s fantastic visual style and marvelous soundtrack, its every idiosyncrasy miraculously blends into an inviting, cohesive whole.
editorialNotes.short: Geneva Hodgson: Story editor, Donut County

editorialNotes.standard: When young astronaut Kosmo sees his robot girlfriend, Nova, blown to pieces before his eyes, he gallantly sets off across the galaxy to find his beloved’s parts and put her back together. This beautiful and whimsical point-and-click adventure will steal your heart as you visit dozens of kooky planets and encounter everything from alien arcades to robot discos. Each unique world introduces adorable critters, fantastic sights, clever puzzles to solve, and tokens of affection to discover. Star-crossed romance has never felt so rewarding.
Science rules in this elegant, minimalist puzzler, where you form chemical bonds while paving pathways through grids.
